intro: Elleanthus lepidus, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery, hairy leaves and bright yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its small, daisy-like flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Elleanthus lepidus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and floral display.
